content.label: This game would sell amazingly on Switch. Dead Cells is doing great right now and I feel this game is slightly better than Dead Cells. The gameplay loop feels very similar despite being top down vs side scrolling. It‚Äôs a day-one purchase for me if you bring it to Switch. $9.99 or $14.99 would be the best price point. Though as good as this game is, if you included some new content like one new area and a new class I think $19.99 would be doable as well. Seriously you guys this game is perfect for that platform. ****ACTUAL REVIEW**** What can I say? This game is seriously a masterpiece in game design. The procedural generation is some of the best you‚Äôll ever play. The classes, weapons, and abilities are fun and unique. I really like how the progression works where if you beat a ‚Äúlevel‚Äù and have opened a new level, you can go straight to the new unlocked level instead of doing the entire game over when you die. This keeps the rougelike tension going without punishing you too much when you die. The levels are fairly long so you still feel the roguelike sting when you die, as you have to replay the entire area. Combat is satisfying, as are the different abilities and weapons to experiment with. There is a dash that includes a swing of your sword that I absolutely love. I prefer melee in general but the projectile weapons and magic are unbelievably fun to use. I truly think this is one of the most under appreciated and underrated games on the AppStore. Seriously great work devs, and for the love of God, PLEASE bring it to Switch so I can play this on the go with physical controls on this large screen. I want it SO bad!

I did NOT expect to see a reference to Mage Gauntlet in this game, that was such a lovely surprise! I got this game about a year or more ago and haven't played for quite a while, but it‚Äôs awesome to see that there are still things to see now matter how long you‚Äôve been playing for.

title.label: U guys need to update the game

content.label: It‚Äôs a great game. Continue what u started...

This is a counter review for johnnn 1. it‚Äôs a rouge like you‚Äôre supposed to reset after each game 2. the mage can‚Äôt fire due to platform limitations. 3. you don‚Äôt have to grind unless you want to, I beat the first boss with zero upgrades. I think you‚Äôre just bad at it
so there you go you‚Äôre welcome Love this game and hat to see someone bashing it for not being a complete exact remake or soft reboot.

Quite an addictive game that you can‚Äôt miss out on. Two major annoyances you should be prepared to deal with: 

1) The game doesn‚Äôt always work as expected. Controls can sometimes not respond like you want ‚Äòem, or the monsters‚Äô behavior spontaneously deviates from its usual pattern. You might find that you randomly get hit by a monster who only uses magic attacks even when your magic shield is up. It‚Äôs frustrating, but makes the game more challenging. 

2) The game doesn‚Äôt let you play your own audio. The music is amazing! Props to Joey Grady. But after hours of game play, sometimes you just wanna switch it up with your own soundtrack.

Nevertheless, this is an epic dungeon crawler with fun characters and a nostalgic retro vibe. If you download his game, prepare to lose hours of your day on it.

This game is amazing and has so much potential. completely worth the money I spent and the incredibly hard work I‚Äôm sure was put in by the developers. I would love to see more armor options (chest, legs, capes, etc) that are permanent upon death like the helmets. As well as more upgrades for classes, those are really good. Maybe  permanent special abilities that can be unlocked for a lot of coins? Keep doing what y‚Äôall are doing, this is an amazing game.
Still waiting on that final update that‚Äôs ‚Äúcoming soon‚Äù

Wayward Souls manages to be a little but unique every time you turn it on. I don't know if it's technically procedurally generated but it feels as if it is. The three unlockable classes are all enjoyable and worthwhile. Don't let the initial difficulty of some areas beat you down: It's worth it. The story is strange and filled with little meanings- the combat is challenging and fairly rewarding. The level design reminds me of old school Gauntlet. I only wish this had a Diablo/Gauntlet esque multiplayer mode. (:

I love this game, the various monsters, the upgrades, the dialogue, and if your lucky enough you can even catch some of the bad guys talking to each other, but I think there should be at least 1 or 2 health potions every 2 floors, because there‚Äôs barley any. Another thing I want to point out is the main storyline, it‚Äôs kinda hard to understand with all the side characters stories, and finally I think the controls could use a little more fixing, but other than that stuff it‚Äôs a great game!

Game‚Äôs pretty decent for a rogue-like. First two levels are an enjoyable challenge, but the third level is such an insane jump in difficulty that‚Äôs it‚Äôs just annoying, not enjoyable. I hear there‚Äôs a fourth level as well, and I can‚Äôt imagine playing this game enough so that I get there. It‚Äôs just boring to get killed after 4 fights repeatedly.

There hasn‚Äôt been an update in a whole year and I‚Äôm a bit disappointed as the paladin seemed quite fun to play as shown from the tutorial stage, and they have yet to release him as I‚Äôm writing this in 2018. The entire game is astonishingly fun, and the diverse weapons and abilities plus the randomized upgrades are very entertaining since sometimes your upgrades aren‚Äôt what you‚Äôd like and you have to adjust to them. The bosses are well made, and the difficulty stacks up against even Dark Souls in my opinion. The third gold level is greatly difficult and I have yet to clear it, having only reached floor 7 of the Catacombs. But that doesn‚Äôt stop me due to the randomly generated floors which leads to a ton of fun. I‚Äôd give this 15 stars if I was able to.
Rocketcat Never disappoints but man they need to update their games so I can keep playing them! If this one could get iPhone X support it‚Äôd be an easy 5 Star!

title.label: Great game but ready for change

content.label: This game is honestly so good. I have been playing it forever and it is honestly one of the best I‚Äôve found on IOS. I come back and play it all the time and is definitely worth the 7.00 dollers. I do kinda really want the paladin to come soon because a new character would be great to play with...even though I haven‚Äôt completely beaten any one character. I just really liked playing as him in the tutorial.

This game is so great. After you beat it, you might even get post game depression. The story is awesome, the battles challenging but possible, and some music is just absolutely amazing, like the theme before the final boss and. This game is definitely worth $7.00 but i think its worth at least triple that. There is a variety of gameplay between the heroes and if you beat everything with every character, you could try to defeat the tutorial boss. This game also works on some older devices and was definitely worth the grab. Thanks for such an amazing game!

While it is definitely exiting to find all of the hats, and the story is cool too, the game kind of wore out the more I grinded.
It was really fun while it lasted, but that‚Äôs about it.

title.label: Why Would I Buy Your Zombie Game?

content.label:
Where is our Paladin Update?  It‚Äôs been over a year since your ETA.  RocketCat has become just another greedy developer focused on paid content updates or ‚ÄúDLC‚Äù.  They take it a step further and make all DLC mandatory while also exploiting the concept of ‚ÄúEarly Access‚Äù to profit off of development rather than production.

Your games are simply not good enough to warrant this ridiculous attitude.

Great game, but on iPhone X it's not very nice, could be a lot better.

Would give a 5 star if it supported iPhone X.
Good game. But I‚Äôm a little annoyed that I payed for a game, that no matter how many times I close it out and reload it, or delete the app and redowload it, the sound doesn‚Äôt work. W. T. F.
Love everything about this game. The only thing missing for me is an update to support the iPhone X screen size.
Controls are a mess and very inconsistent. Various gestures just don‚Äôt work consistently. Waste of 6.99.

This game is absolutely fantastic. Seven people are led to a tower in which they have to destroy an evil mask on the face of a child. I have experienced no lag yet, and it is totally worth the money. 
Here are some reasons why you should get the game.
Literally over 200 hats to collect.
Seven Characters with different backgrounds
80+ enemies, plus hard versions of most enemies.
No lag at all
20+ pets
Lots of character upgrades.
Hilarious descriptions for items and funny ghost conversations.
This game is NOT a continuation of Mage Gauntlet, for your information. I'm also wondering when the paladin update will come on.
Great game, five stars. Try out RocketCat's other games in the App Store, such as Death Road To Canada or PunchQuest. They are also good games.
Really fun dungeon crawler, def worth the money. Will we ever see the paladin class be playable?

title.label: Please edit or let us edit size controls

content.label: The analog stick in this game is TOO BIG when playing in an iPad. Pls make a feat where we can edit the size of the analog stick.

It‚Äôs fun, and it‚Äôs hard. You can‚Äôt expect to win the first, second, third, or maybe even the hundredth try. Eventually, you‚Äôll win, and it‚Äôs very satisfying. The game crashes sometimes, which is why I‚Äôm leaving it at 4 stars. I lose all coins collected during the run whenever it crashes.

... not meant to be a hand-holding experience

Glad to see the app fixed in catacombs! App developers were very friendly and helpful as we worked together to fix the bugs. Still waiting and looking forward to getting back into the game with the final update! 
Old Review: Love the game, but I have one problem. Using the teleporters in the Catacombs causes the game to crash every time on my iPhone 6 Plus iOS 8. Basically unplayable at that point. Can you guys uhh... Fix this?

I see the reviews that are negative and I just don‚Äôt think they understand what this game is. Anyone wondering if this game is worth it and are in to roguelikes as well as a challenge. Do not hesitate. Buy it now.

title.label: One of my favorite iOS games

content.label: Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

This Game is a spin off of Mage Gauntlet. 
Cons
-restart character for each level area
-lose pets at each restart
-thumbs cover up bottom corners of screen
-Mage can't shoot at a diagonal, but enemies can
-can see anything without being in a dark room or brightness all the way up
-Grinding

Pros 
-nice music
-Neat story
-Lore in ghost interactions, and environment 

This game is a spin off of Mage Gauntlet (MG). I was really hoping for a sequel to MG, but was still excited when this came out. Turned out to be a let down, mainly because the lack of a story driven game. 

Wayward reuses the enemies from MG. Same attack patterns; same design; same feel. There's a few new. 

Still have to grind to level up. You do this by grinding for coins to buy upgrades for the characters. Each of which must replay through the areas you've already beaten. Which is a bit annoying but makes sense in the regard that you have to beat the areas with each character to progress each characters story. 

Each new level (mines, tower, etc.)   resets your characters amor and weapons upgrades. So when to beat the mines expecting to continue on to the tower, you instead are kicked out to the start menu and are forced to start the next area with crap gear again. This includes pets. 

The colors are dark making it hard to see outside. 

The Mage character can't shoot diagonal but the enemies can. This is a big disappointment for me cause I like the mages/archer builds in game

I love this game! Every deployment I end up going on I always play the heck out of this game. Wish I hadn't gotten a new phone cuz I lost all my hates but that's fine.

I'd give a 5 star but I'm still waiting on promised updates ü§î so for now a 4 star. I'd give a 3.5 but I can't.

I don't review products very often (mostly because I'm too lazy to do so) but THIS deserves a review with a 10-star rating! The gameplay is quite difficult but addicting; I get frustrated and leave for a while, sure, but I always come back to it. The music is beautifully eerie, too. I eagerly chase new pieces of story that emerge with each playthrough; even something as small as a conversation of two ghosts about one of the Saints statues gives you more info about the world, and I keep finding new tidbits despite having played the levels likely hundreds of times by now! I accidentally missed one by killing the speaker before they finished, and I still regret it. This game builds a true world, which you soon realize the story you're following is only a small part of. Amazing in every way- I could not give constructive criticism even if I tried. It's absolutely worth your money if you like beautiful music, interesting stories and world-building, and challenging but addicting dungeon crawlers (real-time ones, that is). Try this out- if you like these things, you won't regret it!

This is one of the top 5 games I have played on my phone ever. Well made, well balanced, great controls, great customer service when I had an issue, and just a ton of fun. Keep it up Dev's. Will buy anything they make on the future to support.

This game is great, it's tough...it's like chalice dungeon style on your iPhone you will spend a lot of time playing and inching your way through character progression. It's worth the money, I had a ton of fun with Mage Gauntlet too by these guys. If you're on the fence just go for it but don't expect to finish this quickly. It's also perfect for short bursts of play but it's hard to put down.

title.label: Use the stick controls, pay for some upgrades

content.label: I've come to enjoy this game again. Sorry devs for previous reviews.  Very harsh, with just a sweet sliver of surviveable gameplay to lure you on until you can make it through dependably and powerfully.
Dope

I have never written a review for any games however I feel I need to with Wayward Souls. This game has potential to be a great game, however once your character you cannot respawn and it doesn't save anything you collected. Basically you have to restart over EVERY TIME you die. It is very disappointing and can't believe I wasted my money on such a terrible app. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

After reading all the amazing reviews I really expected better. Game is extremely difficult. Which is at first wasn't a big deal but after a while of restarting the same dungeon 20 times it just gets annoying
I can see how some people might like it, but not this many. It was boring, extremely challenging when you first start, and for that much money? If it was free I would understand. Waste of my money.
However I have come across a glitch with the spellsword in which if you do the final blow to an enemy with the drakeleather dash forge upgrade the game crashes and your run is not saved.
Great game. Be better if we could click on our items like weapons and stuff so we can remember what they do.

title.label: Tremendous flavor, Tight controls, Great replay value

content.label:
For a game with controls that are as easy to pick up as this one, it's incredible that there is this much depth behind it. All six of the characters are drastically different and playing each of them will tell you more of the story. I love the art style, the minimal presentation of the interesting stories, the ghostly NPCs acting out events from the past, and the quirky, occasional scripted encounters.

This game starts off simple enough, but it'll push you to master it (I've been playing since it was released and I still haven't beaten the third set of levels). If Dark Souls were made for mobile devices, I feel like it could gain a lot by being based on the engine used in Wayward Souls. I mention Dark Souls instead of Diablo because Dark Souls feels more visceral, more intense, and that is the same sort of gameplay that I get while playing Wayward Souls. Like Dark Souls, Wayward Souls does not hold your hand, nor does it forgive sloppy play. You can make mistakes, sure, but if you make too many they'll add up and you'll end up back at the character select screen, spending the gold you earned to do better next time. Failure isn't punished nearly as badly, and there's a real sense of accomplishment when you finally beat a boss for the first time with a given character. (Seriously. I texted my girlfriend when I finally beat the first boss with the Mage, not because the boss was hard but because the bats - an enemy that gave me no trouble as the Warrior - were incredibly hard for me to fight, and I kept entering the boss fight with almost no health).

Unlike Dark Souls, though, and like Diablo, you will often have to fight several  enemies at once. The game gives you enough tools to make this manageable, though it's a constant challenge. Don't slip up.

But do buy, and play, this game.
Good old school dungeon crawler but TOO hard.
The most challenging yet and I'm up to the challenge! Controls are fine NOT wonky and just need time to get used to. Definitely counts on skill instead of grinding ALTHOUGH, the upgrades do help
Fantastic 2D SNES or ps1 style game.
Games on iOS. If you haven't played it and love Action RPGs, just get started.
Thank you!

Literally the best game on the App Store. It is challenging and fun. If you are a lame and can't stand something that requires some skill don't buy it. Reminds me of games like Secret of Mana, flat out amazing.
Great game love the characters and that amazing adventure also love the amazing powers you get. Get the game nowwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww
Perfect game no complaints

Dying and loosing all items and progress only to start from the very beginning all over again... why? That is the single worst aspect of what might have been a fun game. I want entertainment, not frustration. I had to waste $7 to discover this? Money back please!
I thought that with it's high rating this action game might buck the trend of poor controls, but unfortunately it doesn't. It looks okay, and the music is inoffensive, but it's not worth the money.
